markdownRemark.html:
I started out this year unemployed and depressed. I quit my job in August of 2017 and took several months off to take some trips and figure out what I wanted out of my next job.

As I worked through my depression and felt the helplessness lift off my shoulders, I started to feel very motivated to find my next challenge. I had always worked for small companies and while working through my depression, I realized that a big source of stress for me had been that I would often end up feeling like I had no one to reach out to at work when overwhelmed or feeling stuck. I also didn't feel like I could bounce ideas off anyone because everyone just assumed I was right. I was the one to always get stuff done and usually quickly -- they knew it and I think I encouraged that idea by never pushing back. This led to me being placed in a lot of high pressure situations that'd keep my up at night. And I often felt that it was all my fault so I just had to get through it.

So, in January 2018, I decided I needed to prioritize my mental health more in my next position. I would need to be working on a product I'd be passionate about so that I can look forward to contributing to it even when the pressure is on. I would need it to be 100% remote as I am not a fan of small-talk/distractions/disruptions at the office (at least at home I have more control over them) and prefered to avoid the DFW commute. I also prefer to work heads down when possible. The front-end team would be need to be composed of several experienced engineers that I can continue to learn from and share ideas with.
